plugins.name: FigMath
plugins.description:
FigMath: Mathematical Expression Renderer for Figma


FigMath is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of adding mathematical expressions to your designs. With FigMath, you can effortlessly write mathematical expressions that are rendered to SVG and seamlessly inserted into your Figma projects.


Enjoying my free Figma plugin? ☕ Consider buying me a coffee to fuel future development!


Key Features:


  • Mathematical Expression Input: Easily write mathematical expressions using an intuitive interface directly within Figma. Effortlessly insert complex mathematical symbols and operators with a few clicks.


  • Keyboard-like Feature: Access a virtual keyboard with commonly used mathematical operators and symbols. Quickly filter and select the types of symbols you need for your expressions.


  • SVG Rendering: FigMath automatically renders your mathematical expressions into scalable vector graphics (SVG). Generated SVGs are automatically converted to PNG and directly inserted into your Figma design.


  • Aspect Ratio Control: Modify the dimensions of the inserted mathematical expressions while maintaining correct aspect ratio. Ensure precise control over the size of your mathematical notations within your design.


  • User-Friendly Interface: FigMath is designed to be incredibly user-friendly and easy to use, making it accessible for users of all skill levels. Streamline your workflow with a seamless integration into the Figma environment.


Enhance your Figma design process with FigMath – the ultimate mathematical expression renderer. Whether you're a mathematician, scientist, educator, or designer, FigMath empowers you to bring your mathematical ideas to life in Figma effortlessly.




Get started with FigMath and elevate the way you incorporate mathematical expressions into your Figma projects!
plugins.tagline: Easily insert mathematical formulas

plugins.name: Component Description Manager
plugins.description:
Manage description of all your components in one place!


Each main component (and its variants) can have a description that might be useful for you, other designers and developers. Descriptions can provide tips for using particular component, important dev notes or act as tags for better searching (of icons, for instance).


Without this plugin, you can add a description by selecting the component and opening Component configuration modal from the Design panel. It might quickly become not effective if you want to use it for your entire library.


With this plugin, you can preview and edit descriptions for all components and their variants from a single view.


It works with native Figma feature – it does not store descriptions in any plugin metadata.


To make this experience smooth plugin has a lot of convenient features:

  1. Grouping components by page
  2. Component names that act as a jump-links
  3. Option to turn on/off the visibility of variants
  4. Option to auto-select component upon focusing description field (it helps find proper component with ease)
  5. Option to auto-focus description field upon selecting component on the canvas


Try it out with a playground file to see it in action!
plugins.tagline: Manage descriptions of all your components in one place

plugins.name: Place››holder
plugins.description:
Generate simple and effortless placeholder content for your mockups and prototypes.


Currently Place››holder allows you to generate random UK-styled addresses, names, UK-styled phone numbers and email addresses.


Simply click any of the generate buttons to create a new placeholder text node, or, select an existing text node and hit generate to replace its content, with your existing font.


A super lightweight and simple plugin. Built because I need it, shared because I'm hopeful it's useful to others.

plugins.name: Auto Layout Sorter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you sort child layers of an Auto Layout frame based on their common text layer names. It's an ideal plugin if you work a lot with tables or long lists of components and you don't want to spend time and manual labour to sort each layer by hand. With this plugin you can sort your layers with just a few clicks


**How it works**

1. Select an Auto Layout frame and make sure it has child layers with corresponding text layer names

2. The plugin will check what text values can be sorted and displays this in the plugin interface.

3. Choose the type of text value you want to sort

4. Choose ascending or descending

5. And lastly → hit the 'Sort' button


Your list view has been sorted!


Like using this plugin? Support me via PayPal or Ko-fi ✌️
plugins.tagline: Sort layers of Auto Layout frames based on their equal text values.

plugins.name: Translated
plugins.description:
The TranslationOS plugin for Figma allows you to translate your content directly from Figma in a professional, easy and efficient way with no manual effort. Send your designs for translation in just a few clicks and without switching to other tools.


TranslationOS, by Translated, is the first TMS that directly connects your content with a team of committed linguists, selected from a pool of 519,816 freelancers, trained on your style guides and managed by experienced Language Leads and Project Managers. Customizable dashboards give you access to any KPI that is important to you, including financial projections, quality performance, and information about the linguists involved in your projects.


The TranslationOS connector seamlessly integrates Figma with your TranslationOS solution, streamlining the entire localization process. Figma users can effortlessly send content to TranslationOS and, once translated, retrieve the localized content. They gain full visibility into the process and have control over various elements, such as cost approval and review, making it an exceptionally straightforward experience.


To use the connector, please contact our team
plugins.tagline: Localize Figma designs effortlessly with Translated

plugins.name: Codia AI Illustrator: Adobe Illustrator/EPS to Editable Figma
plugins.description:
Unlock the power of Adobe Illustrator directly within Figma! Our tool lets you import your Illustrator (.ai and .eps) files into Figma with ease, preserving all vector layers, editable text, and design elements. Say goodbye to the hassle of exporting and reformatting — now you can bring logos, graphics, and complex designs straight from Illustrator into Figma as fully editable vectors. Ideal for designers and teams, this tool is perfect for keeping your workflow smooth and efficient, empowering you to build on existing designs without compromising quality or flexibility. Import, edit, and iterate seamlessly across platforms!


Key Features and Advantages:


1. Fast Conversion: Instantly import Adobe Illustrator (.ai and .eps) files into Figma, saving you time and effort with a seamless transition.

2. Fully Editable, Fully Vectorized: Maintain the quality and flexibility of your designs. Imported elements stay in vector format with all text layers fully editable, so you can make changes on the go.

3. Preserves Layer Structure: Keep your layer organization intact. Every element is imported with its original structure, ensuring easy navigation and editing in Figma.

4. Perfect for Logos and Graphics: Ideal for logos, icons, and intricate graphics, this tool supports high-quality vector graphics without loss of detail or quality.

5. Seamless, Software-Free Workflow: Work across platforms without the need for third-party converters or additional software. Just import directly into Figma for a streamlined design process from start to finish.

6. Privacy Protection: Your design files stay secure throughout the import process, ensuring privacy and safeguarding your creative assets. No external servers or tools are used, keeping your data protected.

accepted.name: Codia.AI
accepted.description: Anything to Design, Anything to Code.

plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Bring Your Adobe Illustrator Designs to Figma

Stop wrestling with dozens of effect layers. Liquid Glass automates the complex process of creating depth, lighting, and a true liquid feel, so you can focus on what matters: creating beautiful, futuristic interfaces.


Key Features:

  1. One-Click Magic: Instantly apply a pixel-perfect, iOS-inspired Liquid Glass style to any frame.
  2. Deep Customization: Fine-tune every detail with simple sliders, including corner radius, background blur, opacity, and advanced shadow properties.
  3. Advanced Depth & Lighting: Automatically generates the complex inner shadows, highlights, and fills needed to create a truly three-dimensional feel.
  4. Stay Ahead of the Curve: Effortlessly bring the next generation of UI aesthetics to your projects and wow your clients.

plugins.name: Readdy
plugins.description:
Readdy is an website builder tool, now you can use this plugin to export to Figma.


How to Use:

https://help.readdy.ai/en/help/articles/4623808-how-to-export-design


FAQ

1.How export Current Page State to Figma Canvas（What you currently see in your eyes） —including any interactive or dynamically changed content—directly into Figma.


Step 1. Trigger the state of the page to the state you want to export, such as when a pop-up appears or when the second tab is selected.

Step 2. Click the [Export] Button

Step 3. Click Copy

Step 4. Paste to Readdy Figma Plugin


Now, the exact UI state as seen on the page can be exported into Figma.



2.Why can’t export the whole interactions or prototype to Figma?


Because its canvas is a static canvas, it can’t play the prototype or interactions.



You can contact us any time: hi@readdy.ai
plugins.tagline: Export to Figma

Because its canvas is a static canvas, it can’t play the prototype or interactions.

plugins.name: Placeholdate
plugins.description:
Quickly generate placeholder dates for your mockups, and format those dates however you want. This plugin relies heavily on the basic formatting features from day.js.


There are plenty of plugins out there that help populate your design with placeholder data. None of them provide flexibility with dates. This plugin was created to fill this gap.


At this time, Placeholdate does not support locales or advanced formatting. If this is a feature you need, please submit a GitHub Issue explaining your use case and the expected output.


Examples

If you are unfamiliar with day.js, you can try out these examples by pasting the format in the Date Format field in the plugin UI. These examples assume that the randomly selected date is set to "2022-04-25T22:16:35-06:00".


  • YYYY-MM-DD = 2022-04-25
  • MM/DD/YYYY = 04/25/2022
  • M/D/YY = 4/25/22
  • MMM D, YYYY = Apr 25, 2022
  • MMMM D, YYYY = April 25, 2022
  • dddd MMMM D, YYYY = Monday April 25, 2022
  • hh:mm a = 10:16 pm
  • hh:mm:ss A = 10:16:35 PM
  • [Meeting:] MMM D @ hh:mm A = Meeting: Apr 25 @ 10:16 PM


Many more combinations can be found on the day.js documentation.


Features

  • Select multiple text layers to generate multiple random dates.
  • Format dates according to your needs. The default is YYYY-MM-DD when the plugin is first opened.
  • Select a date range to start and end the random generation. The default is two years before and after the day the plugin is first opened.
  • Sort the generated dates in random order, ascending order, or descending order. NOTE: due to some Figma limitations, the order is set by when the text node was created. It will not sort on layer position or x/y position on the page.
  • Placeholdate will remember your last used format and options when you re-open the plugin.


Be Aware of the Following

  • Make sure to select text layers for this to work. Selecting a frame or group will not insert dates into child text layers.
  • Make sure that the starting date option is before the ending date. It will tell you if it is not the case.
  • Typing out the year in the start or end date field can accept more than 4 digits, but it will produce unexpected results. Just don't do it.

plugins.name: Very Good Flutter Styles
plugins.description:
Very Good Flutter Styles can instantly generate Flutter theme code directly from the color and text styles in your Figma document. Simply run the plugin, then copy and paste the code into your project. Save yourself the time and headache of finding, copying, and formatting style properties with Very Good Flutter Styles!


The plugin uses the existing names and order of your Figma styles, giving you more control around the output of your code. It will also strip out common special characters used for organization, and set your styles names to lowerCamelCase. The generated code is intended to be flexible enough to be used as is, or reformatted to fit the needs of your project.


Open up the playground file to see some examples of styles which include various supported properties; gradients, opacity, multiple fills, italics, underlines, and more. Then unleash the power of the plugin on your own design files!


Instructions

  1. Run the plugin in Design or Dev Mode
  2. Click the Color or Text Styles button to copy Color or Text styles to your clipboard
  3. Paste the code into your code editor


Features

  1. NEW: Hide styles: Control which styles are exported by excluding styles hidden using . and _
  2. Copy all document color and text styles from Figma, paste as dart code.
  3. Works in both Design & Dev Modes
  4. Style names are converted to camelCase, and will remove the following characters: ( ) [ ] { } . , _ - – — / | \
  5. Opacity is reflected in the 8 digit alpha hex value
  6. This plugin will convert styles with 2 fills into a single calculated alpha hex value, great for Material surfaces
  7. Gradient step color values are supported


Not Supported

Variables

  1. Variables are not supported in this release. We are looking to enable supporting variables either in a future release or a separate plugin.


Color Styles

  1. Gradient step positions
  2. Image styles
  3. Layer modes (Multiply, etc)
  4. More than 2 colors per style


Text Styles

  1. Alignment
  2. Case formatting
  3. Lists
  4. Paragraph spacing

plugins.name: Data Populator
plugins.description:
Figma Data Populator makes using real, meaningful data faster and easier than ever. Inspired by Sketch Data Populator, this plugin allows you to connect a JSON data source and quickly populate text and images.

Try it out

  1 - Click “Manage Data Source” and add the demo JSON file: https://api.myjson.com/bins/zdv2i
  2 - Create a Text layer and rename it "{name.first}"
  3 - Create a Rectangle or Ellipse layer and rename it "{avatar}"
  4 - Create another text layer, rename it “location” and type into it “{location.city}, {location.country}”
  5 - Select all your new layers and click “Populate”.
  6 - Turn the layers into a component and populate again. Note how all the layers within a component or instance will be populated with data from the same record.

---------------

Adding a data source

  •  Try http://myjson.com/ for simple JSON hosting.
  •  If you want to populate layers randomly, use arrays in your first level of JSON values, e.g. { “users": [ object1, object2, …, objectN ], “jobs”: [ objectA, objectB, …, objectC ] }.
  •  Data from these objects is referenced using curly brackets {…} and dot notation, allowing you to populate structured data like {users.name.first} and {jobs.description}.
  •  If you only have a single array, you don’t need to reference the first key. E.g. for { “data": [ object1, object2, …, objectN ] }, write {name.first} instead of {data.name.first}

Populating text

  •  Populate an entire text layer by renaming the layer. 
  •  Alternatively populate a part of a text layer by adding your curly brackets within the text (e.g. “I love {location.city}” becomes “I love New York”). 
  •  The plugin remembers the parts it populated, so you can populate the same layers again and again.

Populating images

  •  Populate images by renaming a shape layer. 
  •  The data source for images must be a URL to a hosted image.
  •  Try https://source.unsplash.com/ for easy hosted images.

Populating a component/instance

  •  When you select a bunch of regular layers, the plugin randomly chooses the records to populate them with. If you want them to all be populated from the same record, turn them into a component (or instance).
  •  Add data to your library components so that they’re ready to go!

Roadmap...?

  •  Manage multiple data sources
  •  Use data from google sheets and other sources
  •  Basic functions like random() and if()
  •  DM me suggestions!

plugins.name: Sticky Tags
plugins.description:
Sticky Tags is a text-based tagging tool designed to help you and your team speed up your research synthesis in FigJam.


You can easily add tags by typing the tag label into the input field on the plugin window. Once a tag is added (or is found in your file) it will show up in the Tags section in a purple box. Clicking one of these tags will add it to your selected sticky notes if it’s not already on all of them.


You can also remove tags from your selected sticky notes by clicking the bright purple box containing the tag label in the plugin window. If the tag is bright, this means that it is on all of your selected sticky notes.


Finally, you can cluster sticky notes into sections automatically by tag, colour, or author. This feature will create a copy of your sticky notes and place it into every category (e.g. tag, colour, author) that it fits into. This will save you the time of re-organising your sticky notes into clusters once they’ve been tagged.


Limitations:

  1. Once a tag has been removed from all sticky notes in your file it will no longer show up in the plugin window’s list of tags. In the future, I may look into adding the ability to pin tags.
  2. Once a tag has been added it cannot be edited through the plugin. This can be done simply using the built-in find and replace feature in FigJam however. The plugin UI will update once your selection changes to reflect changes made through find and replace or manual tagging.


Extra tips/features

  1. Use the edit symbols feature in the accordion at the bottom of the plugin window to change the preset tag symbols. You will need to manually use the find and replace feature to swap pre-existing tags to match your new format.


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

☕️ If you love this plugin and would like to support me, you can buy me a coffee at: https://buymeacoffee.com/figmargaux
plugins.tagline: Speed up your synthesis with customisable text-based tags and automatic clustering into sections.

plugins.name: Art Gallery
plugins.description:
Position your designs among the greatest works from the Rijksmuseum


Description

Sometimes you just want to get some inspiration and what's better than going to the museum? Well, letting the museum come to you! With this plugin you can view some of the masterpieces in the Rijksmuseum, in Amsterdam, right inside your design tools. So if you're just in need of some inspiration or if you think your designs belong in the museum, run the plugin and import some art!


How does it work?

Using the filters, you'll do a request to the RijksData API for an artwork. In this API, the artwork is cut up into rectangular tiles with a fixed size. These tiles are then stitched together in your figma/figjam file and together they create a representation of the actual artwork.


A higher quality setting in the UI means the artwork is cut up into more (high quality) tiles and creates a larger artwork.


Features

  1. Select type of art
  2. Free-form text search, to find a specific artwork or artist
  3. Quality select (higher quality = more tiles)
  4. Filter on 'on display in museum'
  5. Show / Hide caption
  6. Show / Hide frame


Known issues

As the plugin currently generates an image for every tile, the plugin can use quite a bit of memory. If the plugin suddenly doesn't work, check the console to see if this is the case and/or restart the figma file to reset.



With thanks to

Rijksmuseum and their RijksData API for providing access to these beautiful artworks under the Creative Commons Zero license.
plugins.tagline: Import unique artwork from the Rijksmuseum, Amsterdam

plugins.name: Figma To Roblox
plugins.description:
Export your Figma designs to Roblox


Simple usage:

  1. Run Figma to Roblox
  2. Select the item(s) you wish to export
  3. Click 'Convert Selection'
  4. Download the rbxmx file and import into roblox!


Simple usage (video)


Usage with Images:

  1. Run Figma to Roblox
  2. Navigate to your Credentials
  3. (Step 1) Create a new Api Key (via the 'CREATE API KEY' button)
  4. (Step 2) Give the api key 'Assets API' permission
  5. (Step 3) If you are using my servers as a proxy (default), while it isn't recommended, add `0.0.0.0/0` to the list (since my servers have several different ips, and use cloudflare it'd ruin the inconvenience of this plugin). Optionally, if you're hosting your own proxy just enter your own ip.
  6. Now that you've got an api key, copy and paste it into the 'Cloud API Key' field in the FTR ui (Remember to enter your userid into the 'User ID' field!)
  7. Enable 'Upload Images' (Optionally you can enable 'Export Images' which will export all images and zip them)
  8. Finally, click 'Convert Selection' and wait until you either see a prompt to download or an error pops up
  9. Go into roblox, select 'Import from File' and select the file you just download!


Example usage (video)


To export an element (or a group) make an export setting with the suffix 'EI' (only supports PNG and JPG formats) example


Feel free to suggest updates or report bugs to me:

NoTwistedHere#6703 on Discord

Github repo
plugins.tagline: For the developer who cares

73169.release_notes:
- Added a method for easily importing Images to Roblox
1. Upload the images to your Roblox game. You should see them all in the Asset Manager.
2. Upload the Images to Figma and we will want to add them as custom local styles.
2.1. Click the Icon on the Fill property
2.2. Click the New Variable + button
2.3. Swap from Variable to Style
2.4 Set the Description to the ID of your Image in your Roblox game. It does NOT need to be prefixxed with "rbxassetid://", but it can be.

[Image guide](https://i.imgur.com/cduqTbD.png)

Your Image Labels will now have the Image property set to the ID whenever this Style is used. (Make sure to use the style, rather than reuploading the image.)

plugins.name: Add name and date
plugins.description:
This plugin is a run-and-go tool to add your name and date immediately to selected text layers, frames, groups, or even sections.


Why this plugin?

Comments are useful with the right info of who writes some feedback and when. But a lot of scenarios may not involve "comments". It can be a sticky note on a part of design, or a frame of alternative ideas for your coworker. These scenarios sometimes hardly trigger a conversation, or collaboration by themselves. By adding your dated signature, it becomes more contextual, sequential, and respond-able.


Features

  • Format your first name (even the very first part) and date in ISO format
  • Add the data after any existing string
  • Work with text layers, frames, groups, and sections


Example

From "Idea to Emilia" to "Idea to Emilia - Chien 2022-12-31".

44886.name: Add name and date
44886.description:
This plugin is a run-and-go tool to add your name and date immediately to selected text layers, frames, groups, or even sections.


Why this plugin?

Comments are useful with the right info of who writes some feedback and when. But a lot of scenarios may not involve "comments". It can be a sticky note on a part of design, or a frame of alternative ideas for your coworker. These scenarios sometimes hardly trigger a conversation, or collaboration by themselves. By adding your dated signature, it becomes more contextual, sequential, and respond-able.


Features

  • Format your first name (even the very first part) and date in ISO format
  • Add the data after any existing string
  • Work with text layers, frames, groups, and sections

From "Idea to Emilia" to "Idea to Emilia - Chien 2022-12-31".

plugins.name: Frame Status
plugins.description:
What it is?

Frame Status is a simple plugin used to indicate the status of a screen of a project.


Why?

We try to help thousands of collaborative teams with this simple plugin, we are one of those teams and we can help others. Frame Status indicates the state of a screen on the project. For example: as a designer, you need to indicate the state of your work for your team, stakeholders and clients.


How to use?

Select a frame > Navigate to the Plugins menu > Select Frames Status and them > Select the status of your frame.


Tips

- You can select multiple frames at once. Each frame will get its own status badge.

- Use the keyboard shortcut to quickly set a status: hit `cmd /` in Mac and `ctrl /` on Windows, type a Status (e.g. “Done”) and hit return.


Frame Status is open source, feel free to contribute or to send suggestions: https://github.com/hecvr/status-for-figma.

accepted.name: José Alvarez
accepted.description: I'm a Senior Visual Designer with +10 years of experience focused on designing cross-platform web and mobile applications.

plugins.name: Mockey AI - Mockup Generator
plugins.description:
Mockey AI - Mockup Generator


You can use Mockey AI's huge collection of realistic mockups right in Figma. Pick from categories like devices, clothing, packaging, and print. Turn your Figma designs into realistic product mockups instantly with one click. New mockups are added every day, so you'll always have fresh options to explore!


How to Use:

  1. In the Plugin & Widgets, choose the Mockey AI plugin to use inside your design files.
  2. After installing, open the Mockey AI and Sign up there.
  3. Pick a category like T-shirts, jackets, or notebooks. Each category has different templates you can change.
  4. Choose a template, then tap Upload Design (like a logo or artwork). The AI will make mockups based on your design.
  5. You can tweak the mockup by changing colors, backgrounds, and AI Photoshoot to match your style. The plugin also lets you remove backgrounds and add different scenes.
  6. Use the Preview to check how your mockup looks before you finish it.
  7. When you're happy with it, hit the Download button to save the mockup in a PNG or JPG format that you can use for presentations or marketing.



Can you make mockups in Figma?

You can make mockups in Figma by adding the Mockey AI plugin. With it, you can choose products like clothes, gadgets, or home items. Pick a mockup template, upload your design, customize it, and export your final mockup easily.


Does Figma have free mockups?

Figma provides free mockups on its community page and through plugins. You can find mockups for t-shirts, smartphones, laptops, tablets, and more. By using templates created by other users or plugins like Mockey AI, you get a wide range of options to display your designs easily.


What is the difference between a prototype and a mockup in Figma?

The main difference between a prototype and a mockup in Figma is how they work and how detailed they are. A mockup is a still picture that shows what the design looks like, with colors and text styles. A prototype, on the other hand, is a clickable version of the design that lets you interact with it and see how it works.


How to find mockups in Figma?

To get mockups in Figma, first, add the Mockey AI plugin from the Figma community. Then, open the plugin and look through tons of mockup options. Finally, pick one and either export it or customize it however you like.
plugins.tagline: It's an AI Mockup generator for everything

plugins.name: Polychrom
plugins.description:
Polychrom Contrast Checker


Case 1: Matching text color to the background


Select any object with a solid fill on the canvas, open the Figma properties panel’s color picker, and adjust the color until it reaches your desired contrast level against the object’s background.


This simplicity is achievable thanks to two core features of Polychrom: the background search engine and the highly responsive UI.


Firstly, the moment you select something, the plugin finds the actual background for the selected object and displays the contrast level between them.


Secondly, whenever you alter colors in your selection, Polychrom immediately adjusts to the change.


—


Case 2: Matching the background color to the text


Select two objects, the foreground and the background. Use Figma’s Selection colors to open the color picker, but this time for your background color. As before, adjust the color until it achieves the required contrast.


This could be beneficial when you have, for example, the brand color, and you’re seeking a background color that provides enough contrast.


—


Case 3: Working with multiple objects


Select 3 or more objects, and Polychrom will act exactly like in the first case—it immediately finds the background area—but this time for every selected object. Then it organizes them in a deck of cards.


Note that Polychrom is smart enough to adapt its behavior depending on your needs: for two objects, it shows the contrast between those two, while for 3+ objects, it shows the contrast for each one.


—


Features

  • Displays the contrast level according to the APCA method.
  • Offers text size recommendations for regular (weight 400) and bold (weight 700) font styles, following the APCA contrast-to-font table.
  • Converts original colors to the OKLCH color model, facilitating easy copying of CSS codes to the clipboard. RGB and HEX formats are also available.
  • Full P3 support. Polychrom automatically detects whether your Figma document uses the Display P3 color mode and treats colors accordingly. This guarantees that your text remains legible on all modern displays with confidence.
  • Handling opacities and blend modes. Just picture this: in Figma, you can adjust the alpha for the entire layer and the solid fill simultaneously. Additionally, there might be multiple fills on one layer and several semi-transparent layers stacked on top of each other. Multiply this by 19 blend modes. Mind-blowing, isn’t it? But fear not! Polychrom effortlessly manages almost all possible combinations, no matter how intricately you’ve mixed layers, opacities, and blend modes!


—


What is APCA?

The Accessible Perceptual Contrast Algorithm (APCA) is a novel method for calculating and predicting readability contrast. This model is specially optimized for ensuring accessible color visibility on self-illuminated RGB computer displays and devices. It also addresses the requirements of visually impaired users, focusing on improving visual readability.


APCA is a candidate contrast method for the forthcoming WCAG 3 and is concurrently evolving as the APCA Readability Criterion, an independent standard managed by Inclusive Reading Technologies.


Read more: APCA in a Nutshell.

accepted.name: Evil Martians
accepted.description: We transform growth-stage startups into unicorns, build developer tools, and create open source products

plugins.tagline: Best-in-class modern tool for managing color contrast

plugins.name: Node Inspector
plugins.description:
Node inspector


View and copy node properties for plugin development.

(This plugin is only useful for plugin developers)


—————————————————————————————————

How to use:


- Nodes:

Select one or more nodes in your canvas to view their properties. To select nodes by their ID's, click the arrow icon next to the search bar to access the node selector tool.


- Components:

Enter one or more component keys (for components in shared libraries) and click "Inpsect Components".


- Styles:

Select the method you want to inspect style nodes by (style ID or style keys for shared library styles), then enter one or more ID's/keys to inspect their properties. You can also get a list of all local styles in your file by selecting the "All Local Styles" option in the dropdown.


Note that multiple styles ID's and keys are separated by semi-colons ( ; ) instead of commas ( , ) because style ID's contain commas at the end of the string.


Copy: To copy the entire JSON output, click the "Copy" button at the top right.
plugins.tagline: View and copy node properties for plugin development

65235.name: Node Inspector
65235.description:
Node inspector


View and copy node properties for plugin development.

(This plugin is only useful for plugin developers)


—————————————————————————————————

How to use:


- Nodes:

Select one or more nodes in your canvas to view their properties. To select nodes by their ID's, click the arrow icon next to the search bar to access the node selector tool.


- Components:

Enter one or more component keys (for components in shared libraries) and click "Inpsect Components".


- Styles:

Select the method you want to inspect style nodes by (style ID or style keys for shared library styles), then enter one or more ID's/keys to inspect their properties. You can also get a list of all local styles in your file by selecting the "All Local Styles" option in the dropdown.


Note that multiple styles ID's and keys are separated by semi-colons ( ; ) instead of commas ( , ) because style ID's contain commas at the end of the string.


Copy: To copy the entire JSON output, click the "Copy" button at the top right.
65235.release_notes: added network access and security details
65235.tagline: View and copy node properties for plugin development

plugins.name: Replace component
plugins.description:
Component replacement method:

1. First, select the reusable component and lock it (later selection is optional, later selection does not require locking)

2. Afterwards, choose to replace the target position (multiple choices are allowed, or you can choose first, which needs to be locked)

3. Click on replace


Other functions:

1. Enter search keywords, confirm and go to the target page


替换组件方法：

1，先选择复用组件并锁定（可后选，后选不用锁定）

2，之后选择替换目标位置（可多选,，也可先选，先选需锁定）

3，点击替换


其他功能：

1，输入搜索关键字，确定后前往目标页面
